ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours per week
2-4 hours not including weeks when we had assignments or projects due

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This is a very nice-organized lecture.Guest speakers covered nearly all the aspects of can epiBrenda connected all the topics nicely and logistically.
I really enjoyed this course and learned a lot about different types of cancer.

I really enjoyed the speakers and range of topics covered in this course. I think my favorite lecture was the one on exogenous hormones where it was more discussion based. Perhaps more lectures like that one!
Favorite class at YSPH thus far.

It was a great broad overview of cancer epi, and allowed us to learn about various different cancer sites, issues and special topics. I especially liked that there was a guest lecture almost every week. But for someone who is interested in cancer epidemiology, I would've liked to learn in more detail the methodology behind cancer epi and how to deal with the particular issues associated with this particular area.
I really enjoyed this class. I liked having different guest lecturers each week.
This is a very good course. Its main strengths are that it covers the main topics in cancer epidemiology and that several of these topics are presented by experts in the field.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  brenda is one of the best instructors in YSPH!
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  The instructor was great- I was very happy with this course!
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Thoroughly enjoyed the lectures given by Dr. Cartmel and her interest in getting to know the students!
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda is awesome. We had many guest speakers so I can't really evaluate her teaching.

Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  She is so sweet, friendly, and extremely passionate about this subject matter. She doesn't focus so much on having students conduct tedious work, but rather on students really understanding each lecture and the overall concepts of the course.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Very informative and knowledgeable about the subject which made lectures fun and interesting.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  She is very good for providing explanations in class, and is always open to questions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I highly recommend this course to every student in YSPH who is interested in cancer epi!
I would recommend this course to students who want to learn more about cancer epidemiology.
Good overview of risk factors and different types of cancer. Yes, I would recommend the course
I would definitely recommend it.

If you're interested in cancer epi and are looking for a broad overview of topics, then I would highly recommend this course. The lectures wereall very interesting, and the small class size made it more intimate.
Introduction to different cancers, cancer exposures, and various treatments. Each week there is a different guest lecturer. I would recommend this course if a student had an interest in cancer.
I would recommend it. It is a really good course for those interested in doing cancer research, it covers the main topics in cancer epidemiology.
